intro: Leucostegane, commonly known as the "scentless mayweed," is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and its leaves are typically narrow and linear. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Leucostegane is known for its lack of strong fragrance, which distinguishes it from other similar species in its genus.
